divs: Sighting DetailsI was sitting on my deck in back of the house in New Gloucester, ME. It is a clear night with lots of stars, when something caught my eye in the northeast. It was at a very high angle and moving in a southerly direction, at first I thought it was a sattelite, when suddenly it became extremely bright, then dimmed again still traveling until in a second or two it disapeared. I heard no engines, it was very quiet out there. I ran inside to get my camera hoping it would reappear, but it never did, this all took place about a half hour ago. I'm going back out in case it comes back. Hopefully I can get a picture.
trends: There has been one other sighting in Auburn
There were no other sightings in Auburn on or around August 19th 2009
Summary: a dim star which got intensely bright, then dimmed northeast traveling south, NOT A PLANE OR SATTELITE OR STAR! No sound, way up there.
